author: Shannon Epstein
title: Crockpot Chicken with Apples And Honey
ingredients: 3 pounds chicken, any cut (see blog post) seasoned with salt & pepper
3 pounds chicken, any cut (see blog post) seasoned with salt & pepper

instructions_list: If using potatoes, add those to the bottom of the slow cooker. Add the chicken. Spread diced apples & onion on top of the chicken.
In a small bowl, mix together sauce ingredients until well blended. Pour sauce on top of chicken.

Turn the Instant Pot to saute. Once hot, add the oil. If you’re using skin-on chicken: add the chicken and sear, few minutes on each side until browned. Remove chicken from the pressure cooker. If you’re using skinless chicken, skip this step.
Add onions (and more oil if needed) and cook 3-5 minutes until soft.
In a small bowl, mix together sauce ingredients. Pour the sauce into the pressure cooker and deglaze the bottom of the pressure cooker by scraping all the bits off with a wooden spoon.
Add chicken back into the Instant Pot. Add apples (and potatoes if using) on top.
Close lid and seal valve. Set high pressure and cook 12 minutes. When cook time is complete, quick release the pressure.
description: This slow cooker chicken with apples & honey recipe uses simple ingredients and will impress and crowd. Perfect for Rosh Hashanah, the end result of this crockpot chicken recipe is falling apart chicken & tender apples in a honey sauce. This sweet and savory dish will have your home in an irresistible aroma while it cooks, with minimal effort on your part. Instructions to make this High Holiday chicken recipe in the Instant Pot are also included.

reviews.author: Deanna H
reviews.reviewBody: I made this last year & loved it! My Grandma is still jealous hehe.

reviews.author: Andrea Williams
reviews.reviewBody:
This dish tasted amazing the night I made it, and even better a few days later.

It's definitely worth making a second, third, etc. time!!!!!!!!

reviews.author: Rachael
reviews.reviewBody: Not wanting to mess up my first Rosh Hashanah dinner, I did a test run today. Oh my goodness this was good. And my house smelled wonderful. I halved the recipe & used chicken breasts. Thank you, I will make this again soon.

reviews.author: Geo
reviews.reviewBody: Great way to make chicken .i ran out of honey so the other 1/4 was maple syrup .i give 5 stars
